>> work any more. Do you have a copy of that page?
>
> Unfortunately no.  Did you see this mail sent yesterday?
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/1598.
Yes, i did, some hours after writing my mail. I'm gonna try it.
>
>>   You also mentioned to add some filters in HTTP-Fetcher and
> ARCWriter processors. How can I read the http header and/or the
> content in the
>> ARCWriterProcessor?
>
> Are you trying to exclude certain mimetypes from being fetched and
> from being written to disk or are you trying to do something else.  If
> the former, see the email cited above.
I try the former one, however, the following explanation seems to
be useful for our further work. Thanks.
>  Else, to get at headers, you
> need to go via the CrawlURI:
>
> ((HttpMethod)curi.getObject(A_HTTP_TRANSACTION)).getResponseHeader(HEADER_NAME);
>
> ... where curi is the instance of CrawlURI, A_HTTP_TRANSACTION is a
> define found in org.archive.crawler.datamodel.CoreAttributeConstants
> and where HEADER_NAME is name of header you are interested in: e.g.
> "Server".
>
> To get at the content, again, you'd go via the CrawlURI:
>
> curi.getHttpRecorder().getRecordedInput().getReplayInputStream()
>
> St.Ack
Tamas
